intro: Crotalaria rogersii, commonly known as the desert false flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are usually pinnately compound. Crotalaria rogersii has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to survive in drought conditions.
